intro: Armeriastrum bracteatum, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and gray-green foliage covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a valuable plant for xeriscaping and ecological restoration projects.
